column1: Women, older adults, and people with diabetes are more likely to have subtle or unusual symptoms.

- Cold sweat - Light-headedness - Nausea (more common in women) - Numbness, aching, or tingling in the arm (usually the left arm, but the right arm may be affected alone, or along with the left) - Shortness of breath - Weakness or fatigue, especially in older adults and in women
- Ask if the person takes any chest pain medication, such as nitroglycerin, for a known heart condition, and help them take it.
Call 911 or your local emergency number immediately if the person: - Does not respond to you - Is not breathing - Has sudden chest pain or other symptoms of a heart attack
